page.title: 02FARMING:ECOLOGY
page.content: A rich variety of wildlife ..kestrels,oyster catchers, lapwings, roe deer,rabbits,hares and weasels are found in this area.Development and changing farming methods can have a great impact upon the ecology and appearance of the countryside. New farming techniques and increasingly larger machines often mean the removal of hedgerows and alteration of field bounderies. Areas of semi-natural habitats, particularly shelterbelts and small woodland areas are being reduced and can lessen the ecological value of the countryside and ultimately prove detrimental to crop yields. Whilst these concerns are accepted by farmers and the public,local authority planning powers do not extend to agricultural developments.
